text: My Lord Yahweh showed me this, and there was a basket of summer fruit.
And he said, “What do you see, Amos?” And I said, “A basket of summer fruit.” And Yahweh said to me, “The end has come upon my people Israel. I will not pass by them again!”

“And the songs of the temple shall become wailings in that day,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 8:3 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* my Lord Yahweh. “The corpses are numerous; he throws them in every place. Be quiet!”
Hear this, those who trample on \add the\add* poor and who annihilate the afflicted of \add the\add* land,

saying, “When will the new moon be over, so that we can sell grain? And the Sabbath, so that we can open the grain bins, that we can make \add the\add* ephah small and make \add the\add* shekel large, and can practice deceit \add with\add* a set of scales of deceit?
⸤That we can⸥\f + \fr 8:6 \ft Literally “to buy” \f* buy \add the\add* powerless with silver and \add the\add* poor for the sake of a pair of sandals, and we can sell the waste of the grain?”
Yahweh has sworn by the pride of Jacob, “Surely I will never forget any of their deeds!

On account of this, will not the land tremble and will not every living \add thing\add* in it mourn? And all of it will rise like the Nile and it will be tossed about and subside like the Nile of Egypt.

And then in that day,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 8:9 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* my Lord Yahweh, “I\f + \fr 8:9 \ft Literally “and I” \f* will make the sun go down at noon and I will darken the land on a day of light.

And I will turn your feasts into mourning and all of your songs into lament, and I will put sackcloth on all loins and baldness on every head. And I will make it like the mourning for an only child, and its end like a bitter day.

Look, the days are coming,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 8:11 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* my Lord Yahweh, “when I will send a famine in the land, not a famine for bread and not a thirst for water, but ⸤of hearing⸥\f + \fr 8:11 \ft Literally “but if to hear” \f* the words of Yahweh!
And they will wander from sea to sea and from \add the\add* north and to \add the\add* east. They will roam about to seek the word of Yahweh, but they will not find \add it\add*!
In that day the beautiful young women and the young men will faint because of thirst.
\add These are\add* those who swear by the guilt of Samaria and say, ‘By the life of your gods, O Dan,’ and ‘By the life of the way of Beersheba,’ they will fall and they will not rise again.”
